attributes.action: take the appropriate steps to introduce a cap on Premier League football teams' wage bills.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
No wage cup currently operates for Premier League footballers' wages. While the vast majority of the public struggles with the effects of global recession, the average Premier League footballer earns around £21,000 per week. A league-wide wage cap is supported by the Football Supporters Federation.
While a wage cap exists in League Two and the Blue Square Premier, no such cap exists in the top three tiers.

rejection.details: The Prime Minister and Government have no involvement in the commerical operation of football.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
